the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Vote Leave's Dominic Cummings 'in contempt of Parliament'
column7: date=27 March 2019}}</ref> The resolution admonishing him was passed by resolution of the House of Commons on 2 April 2019.<ref>{{cite web

In July 2017, the lawyer and political commentator, [[David Allen Green]], asked Cummings via Twitter, \"Is there anything which could now happen (or not happen) which would make you now wish Leave had not won the referendum result?\" Cummings replied, \"Lots! I said before REF was dumb idea, other things shdve been tried 1st.\"<ref>{{cite news
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Is Brexit an error? Now even Vote Leave’s chief is having doubts {{!}} Jonathan Freedland

[[File:Peoples Vote March October 3959 Demonic Cummings sculpture.jpg
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: Effigy of Cummings as [[Boris Johnson]]'s puppet-master at the [[People's Vote]] march, in October 2019]]

On 24 July 2019, Cummings was appointed as a Senior Adviser to Prime Minister Boris Johnson.<ref>{{Cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Who is 'career psychopath' Dominic Cummings set to join Johnson's team?

On his appointment, ''[[The Guardian]]'' noted that at a conference in 2017 Cummings had argued that: \"People think, and by the way I think most people are right: 'The Tory party is run by people who basically don't care about people like me{{' \"}}; and that \"Tory MPs largely do not care about these poorer people. They don't care about the NHS. And the public has kind of cottoned on to that\".<ref>{{Cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Dominic Cummings: Tory MPs do not care about poor people or NHS

''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' reported on Cummings's past rivalry with [[Nigel Farage]] from the [[2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum
the Greek myth: 2016 referendum campaign]], and quoted Farage as saying that: \"He has never liked me. He can't stand the [[European Research Group
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: ERG]]. I can't see him coming to any accommodation with anyone. He has huge personal enmity with the true believers in Brexit\".<ref>{{cite news
column6: title=Dominic Cummings and Nigel Farage: the Brexit referendum rivalry that continues to rage

Cummings was accused of hypocrisy when, not long after his appointment, it was revealed that a farm that he co-owns had received €250,000 (£235,000) in [[Common Agricultural Policy
the Greek myth: EU farming subsidies]]. Cummings had previously described such subsidies as \"absurd\", complaining that some of them were handed out to \"very rich landowners to do stupid things\".<ref>{{Cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title= Brexit enforcer Cummings' farm took €235,000 in EU handouts

In November 2019, a [[whistleblower]] raised questions about Cummings' interactions during his years in Russia; ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' reported that Whitehall was keeping certain government business from Cummings.<ref>{{cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Labour asks about Dominic Cummings’ years working in Russia

As per procedure, Cummings temporarily resigned his role when [[Dissolution of the Parliament of the United Kingdom
the Greek myth: Parliament dissolved]] for the [[2019 United Kingdom general election
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: 2019 general election]], along with most special advisers, but was briefly reinstated to assist the government during the [[2019 England floods
column6: title=YouGov poll suggests Tories on course for comfortable general election victory

According to ''[[Politico]]'', Cummings played a role in the Conservative Party's victory in the [[2019 United Kingdom general election
column11: title=We’re all living in Dominic Cummings' world now
column15: accessdate=14 December 2019}}</ref> despite having passed the party's running of the election campaign to [[Isaac Levido]]. After the election, in what was described as an \"unusual move\", Cummings called for people interested in working in government to contact him through a private [[Gmail]] address. In a blog post, he said he wanted to recruit data scientists, software developers and economists to help improve the performance of government, making his own role \"within a year largely redundant\".<ref>{{cite news
column17: title=PM's senior aide Dominic Cummings calls for civil service changes
column20: accessdate=3 January 2020}}</ref> The recruitment drive was reported to have resulted in several appointments on short-term contracts, including [[Alison Wolf, Baroness Wolf of Dulwich
column21: Baroness Wolf of Dulwich]], Professor [[Vernon C. Gibson
column22: Vernon Gibson]] and, briefly, [[Andrew Sabisky]].<ref>{{Cite news
column26: title=Dominic Cummings and Boris Johnson: working in tandem or pulling apart?
column30: url-status=live}}</ref> Sabisky resigned in February 2020 following complaints about his previously expressed views on race, intelligence and eugenics.<ref>{{Cite news
column32: title=No 10 adviser resigns over alleged race comments

In 2012, a senior female civil servant received a payout of £25,000 in a bullying case she took against Cummings and a senior member of Michael Gove’s team, when Cummings was a special adviser at the Department for Education.<ref>{{cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Cummings and Johnson face backlash over sacking of advisers
title=Priti Patel accused of bullying a third senior civil servant

On 31 August 2019, ''The Guardian'' reported that Cummings had fired one of [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]] [[Sajid Javid]]'s aides, Sonia Khan, without Javid's permission and without informing him. Allegedly, \"Having summoned her to No 10 on Thursday evening to question her, Cummings took her two phones, one used for private calls and one for work, and fired her after seeing she had talked to an ex-aide to [[Philip Hammond]] the previous week. Cummings then went outside No 10 and asked an armed officer to enter the building and escort Khan off the premises.\"<ref>{{Cite newspaper
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=PM 'must launch urgent inquiry into Dominic Cummings’s reign of terror'
column9: newspaper=[[The Guardian]]}}</ref> The following month, ''[[The Times]]'' reported that Cummings had \"seized new powers to sack ministers' advisers\", as their new employment contracts stipulated that responsibility for disciplinary matters rested with the Prime Minister's [[Downing Street Chief of Staff
column10: Chief of Staff]] as well as with their respective ministers.<ref>{{cite news
column12: title=Dominic Cummings cements his power to sack advisers

In March 2020, it was reported in ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' that during a private engagement the previous month, Cummings had claimed that the government's strategy towards the coronavirus was \"herd immunity, protect the economy and if that means some pensioners die, too bad\". The spokesman for [[10 Downing Street]] decried the article as \"a highly defamatory fabrication\" which \"includes a series of apparent quotes from meetings which are invented\".<ref>{{cite news
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=No 10 denies claim Dominic Cummings argued to 'let old people die'
column8: date=22 March 2020}}</ref>  On 30 March, Cummings displayed symptoms of [[COVID-19]] during the [[2019-20 coronavirus pandemic]] and is reported to be self isolating. This was three days after Johnson was tested positive for the virus.<ref>{{cite news
column12: title=Dominic Cummings self-isolates after he develops coronavirus symptoms

Cummings has described his political views as \"not Tory (Conservative), libertarian, 'populist' or anything else\".<ref>{{Cite news
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=An archetypal rebel - how Johnson's chief adviser is driving Brexit

In January 2016, five months prior to the [[2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum
the Greek myth: 2016 European Union referendum]] in the United Kingdom, Cummings said:

\"Extremists are on the rise in Europe and are being fuelled unfortunately by the Euro project and by the centralisation of power in Brussels. It is increasingly important that Britain offers an example of civilised, democratic, liberal self-government\"<ref>{{cite news

Ogilvy]] conference in 2017, Cummings stated his belief that the EU, rather than solving issues, was fuelling radicalism and extremism due to a perceived lack of control over issues such as economy and immigration:

\"For me ... the worst-case scenario for Europe is a return to 1930s-style protectionism and extremism. And to me the EU project, the Eurozone project, are driving the growth of extremism. The single most important reason, really, for why I wanted to get out of the EU is I think that it will drain the poison of a lot of political debates ... UKIP and Nigel Farage would be finished. Once there’s democratic control of immigration policy, immigration will go back to being a second- or third-order issue.\"<ref name=\"foreign policy\">{{cite news
column5: title=Can Dominic Cummings Banish Nativist Populism From U.K. Politics?

Cummings has frequently attacked what he sees as a London-centred political system that failed to countenance the United Kingdom’s voting to leave the European Union. In December 2019, following the [[2019 United Kingdom general election
the Greek myth: General Election]], which returned an 80-seat Conservative majority, he stated:

\"After the shock of the referendum, MPs and journalists should have taken a breath and had a lot of self-reflection [on] why they misunderstood what was going on in the country. Instead a lot of people just doubled down on their own ideas and f***ed it up even more. That’s why something like this happens against expectations.\"<ref name=\"timesdec19\">{{Cite web
column5: title=Dominic Cummings: Educated Remainer types failed to read mood of the country

He has expressed his dismay that many voters' concerns, particularly in Northern England and the Midlands, have been ignored by both the Conservatives and Labour and 'taken for granted'.<ref name=\"timesdec19\"/> He criticised New Labour's attempt at re-balancing inherent structural deficiencies within the British economy following de-industrialisation with a system of tax credits.<ref name=\"timesdec19\"/>
Cummings has claimed never to have been a member of a political party.<ref>{{cite web
column5: access-date=9 January 2019}}</ref> Despite this, he was second in a list by [[LBC]] of the 'Top 100 Most Influential Conservatives of 2019'.<ref>{{Cite web
column7: title=The Top 100 Most Influential Conservatives of 2019

In December 2011, Cummings married Mary Wakefield, sister of his friend Jack Wakefield,<ref name=\"ft.com\">{{cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Dominic Cummings has 'done' Brexit. Now he plans to reinvent politics
column7: access-date=12 April 2020}}</ref> former director of the [[Dmytro Firtash
column10: title=FIRTASH: How the Trump Impeachment Scandal Leads back to British Brexiters
column15: access-date=12 April 2020}}</ref> Mary Wakefield has worked at the weekly magazine ''[[The Spectator]]'' for decades, since Boris Johnson was editor, and is now commissioning editor. She is the daughter of [[Humphry Wakefield
column16: Sir Humphry Wakefield]], of [[Chillingham Castle]] in [[Northumberland]].<ref name=\"theindependent1\">{{cite news
column18: title=Dominic Cummings: The Vote Leave chief who invented £350m claim before admitting Brexit was a mistake

In 2016, they had a son,<ref>Rabbett, Abigail; Morley, Nicole (8 January 2019). [https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/who-dominic-cummings-durham-man-15643998 \"Who is Dominic Cummings? The Durham man behind Brexit played by Benedict Cumberbatch in Channel 4 show\"]. ''[[Evening Chronicle]]''.</ref><ref>Wakefield, Mary (10 August 2019). [https://www.spectator.co.uk/2019/08/the-reason-middle-class-parents-are-so-anxious \"The reason middle-class parents are so anxious\"]. ''[[The Spectator]]''.</ref> Alexander Cedd, named after [[Cedd

Cummings is reportedly an admirer of [[Otto von Bismarck]], [[Richard Feynman]], [[Sun Tzu]],<ref name=\"foreign policy\"/> and U.S. fighter pilot and military strategist [[John Boyd (military strategist)
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=The US fighter pilot inspiring Boris Johnson’s most powerful adviser
column6: date=17 August 2019}}</ref> Journalist [[Owen Bennett]] claimed that Cummings \"is a [[Russophilia
column8: Russian]], and is passionately interested in [[Fyodor Dostoevsky
column9: Dostoyevsky]]\",<ref name=\"OwenBennett\"/> while [[Patrick Wintour]] in ''[[The Guardian]]'' reported that \"[[Anna Karenina]], maths and Bismarck are his three obsessions.\"<ref name=\"pwintour1\">{{Cite web
column10: title= Dominic Cummings: master of the dark arts handed keys to No 10

Cummings was portrayed by [[Benedict Cumberbatch]] in the 2019 [[Channel 4]] drama ''[[Brexit: The Uncivil War]]''.<ref>{{Cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Brexit: The Uncivil War review: Benedict Cumberbatch is superb in this thrilling romp through the referendum
column12: title=Vote Leave's Matthew Elliott on Channel 4's Brexit: The Uncivil War
column17: quote=Screenwriter James Graham has turned the campaign into a compelling story – and nailed my mannerisms}}</ref>

Cummings is registered as a director of the non-trading company Klute Ltd, which formerly owned the Klute nightclub in Durham,<ref>{{Cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=KLUTE LIMITED – Overview (free company information from Companies House)
column7: title=Dominic Cummings was doorman at 'Europe's worst nightclub'
column11: date=26 July 2019}}</ref> and Dynamic Maps Ltd, an information technology consultancy.<ref>{{Cite web
column13: title=DYNAMIC MAPS LIMITED – Overview (free company information from Companies House)
column14: website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk}}</ref> He runs another company called North Wood that \"tries to solve problems\" related to management, politics and communications.<ref>{{cite web

The Labours of Hercules}}: title= Meet the real brains behind Boris Johnson's Brexit plan

* [https://web.archive.org/web/20051018115349/http://www.new-frontiers.org/home/home.aspx New Frontiers Foundation] website, archived in 2005

the Greek myth: image = 2014 Nissan Rogue S AWD front left.jpg

the short story collection by Agatha Chr: crossover SUV]] produced by the [[Japan]]ese automobile manufacturer [[Nissan Motors
The Labours of Hercules}}: Nissan]].  It made its debut in October 2007 for the 2008 model year.<ref name=\"3rd\">{{cite web
column6: title=New Nissan Rogue Third-Best-Seller for Company
column11: archivedate=2012-12-29}}</ref> The current model, the second generation launched in 2013, is the [[United States of America]]’s and [[Canada]]’s version of the [[Nissan X-Trail]].

It is currently Nissan's best-selling vehicle in the [[United States]].<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan scores as top brand in 2017 AutoPacific Vehicle Satisfaction Awards with five Best in Class wins - Automotive World
column10: title=May U.S. auto sales: Ford outsells GM in surprise turnabout

The Rogue is powered by a {{convert
column8: QR25DE]] engine mated to a standard [[continuously variable transmission]],<ref>{{cite web
column12: accessdate=2016-02-29}}</ref> and comes standard with front-wheel-drive. The Rogue costs less than Nissan's [[Nissan Murano
column25: accessdate=2016-02-29}}</ref> offers only slightly less passenger volume than its V6-powered sibling, and a nearly equal cargo area of {{convert

The first generation Rogue remained in production for the 2013–2015 model years as the Rogue Select.{{citation needed
The Rogue is manufactured at the [[Nissan Smyrna assembly plant]] in [[Tennessee, United States]].

The Nissan Rogue made its debut at the [[North American International Auto Show]] in [[Detroit]] on January 7, 2007. It replaces the [[Nissan X-Trail]] in [[Canada]] as Nissan's entry-level [[Sport utility vehicle
the Greek myth: SUV]] and the [[body-on-frame]] [[Nissan Xterra]] in [[Mexico]] due to the Smyrna plant freeing capacity for the 2009 [[Suzuki Equator]], but the [[Nissan Xterra
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: Xterra]] continued on sale in the [[United States]] and [[Canada]] through 2015 after being withdrawn from the Mexican market after the 2008 model year.

The Rogue comes in three trims in the United States:  S,SV and SL. S is the base model, which comes factory equipped with [[anti-lock brakes]]; air conditioning; cruise control; power windows, locks, and mirrors; remote keyless entry; and AM/FM/CD stereo with four speakers and auxiliary input jack.<ref>{{cite web

An optional \"360 Value\" package on the S model adds 16-inch alloy wheels, auto-dimming rear-view mirror with rear-view monitor, body-color rear spoiler, chrome grille, and rear privacy glass. An S Krōm trim edition includes Krōm integrated body design, center-exit exhaust, body-color rear spoiler, 17-inch brilliant-finish aluminum-alloy wheels, and rear privacy glass.<ref>{{cite web
Both trims are available with [[front-wheel drive]] and [[all-wheel drive]].<ref>{{cite web

Safety features in the Rogue include front airbags, side-impact airbags, side-curtain airbags with rollover sensors, tire-pressure monitor, ABS with brake-assist and electronic brake-force distribution, traction control, and anti-skid control. The following summarizes the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA) Crash Test Ratings<ref>{{cite web

In the IIHS evaluation of the 2013 model year, the Rogue achieved a \"Good\" [[crashworthiness]] rating for Head Restraints & Seats, Side, and Moderate Overlap Front, while achieving an “Acceptable” rating in Roof Strength, and a \"Marginal\" rating in Small Overlap Front. Modifications were made starting in the 2014 model year which increased the Small Overlap Front and Roof Strength ratings to \"Good\".<ref>{{Cite web
* 2010 Rogue Awarded ''[[Consumers Digest]]''{{'}}s Automotive Best Buy Award.
* 2010 Rogue Received the U.S. [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA)'s Highest Side-Impact Safety Rating(five stars).

Changes to the Rogue include redesigned gauges recolored from orange to black, redesigned center dash for addition of the navigation system, redesigned exterior featuring a new front fascia and grille, new front and rear spoilers, new chrome side door guard molding trim accents, new front and rear tire deflectors and a new chrome license plate finisher; new 18-inch aluminum-alloy wheels for the Rogue S Krōm Edition and Rogue SL Package, new low rolling resistance tires (available with the 17-inch aluminum-alloy wheels) and a new under-body cover.

The Rogue S Krōm Edition is a version of Rogue S with more aggressive styling, sport-tuned exhaust, 18-inch polished wheels and tires, a unique grille and bumper with fog lamps, and other styling tweaks. The vehicle was unveiled at the 23rd Annual International Z Car Convention in Nashville.
US models went on sale at Nissan dealers nationwide beginning August 13, 2010. Early models include S and SV.<ref>{{cite web
The SV is available with an optional SL package, adding leather seats, touch screen navigation system and 18\" alloy wheels, along with other premium features.
Nissan vehicles with [[Garmin]] Navi 750, 760 and 765 GPS devices, which included Rogue sold with the Garmin devices between 2008 and 2010, were recalled in 2010 due to overheating.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan joins overheating Garmin sat-nav recall
column8: archivedate=13 July 2017}}</ref> On November 23, 2011 Nissan announced a recall of 7,365 2011 Rogue vehicles for improperly manufactured electric power steering (EPS) assist units, which over time could cause the power assist feature to fail, causing a loss of power assist and an increased risk of an accident.<ref>{{cite web
column16: title=Nissan recalls 2011 Rogue over power steering concern

Changes to 2012 Rogue includes new aluminum-alloy wheels design, sport mode to the CVT, one new exterior color (Graphite Blue), Around View Monitor for SL package, which creates a composite top-view of the vehicle's surrounding and displays it through a LCD monitor.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2012 Nissan Rogue gains optional Around View Monitor [w/video]

\"Special Edition\" (replaced \"Krom\" edition) adds 16-inch alloy wheels, a premium audio system, satellite radio, privacy glass, rearview monitor, and fog lamps to the S trim.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title= 2012 Nissan Rogue gains Around View monitor
column10: title=2012 Nissan Rogue Gets a Tiny Price Bump

In Canada, the Rogue comes in S and SV trim in front- or all-wheel-drive, and in a top-line SL trim in all-wheel-drive.
In February 2012, Nissan recalled 2,983 MY 2012 versions of the Murano and Rogue, because the tire pressure monitoring system was not activated when the cars were assembled.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2012 Nissan Murano, Rogue: Recall Alert

The Select was a continuation of the first generation Rogue sold alongside an all-new Rogue that went on sale in 2013 as a 2014 model.  Since the production capacity allowed for the first generation to be built in conjunction with the 2nd generation, it allowed for a lower entry price to Rogue customers as well as fleet sales. It went on sale in January 2014 as a 2014 model year vehicle and was continued through 2015.  Nissan then announced that 2015 would be the final year.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan's current Rogue renamed Rogue Select, will live alongside next gen
column8: archivedate=7 September 2017}}</ref> The Rogue Select was not offered in Canada.

The Rogue Select was built in Nissan's [[Kyushu, Japan]] plant.<ref>

the Greek myth: image = 2014 Nissan Rogue S AWD front left.jpg

column15: [[Gangseo District, Busan]], [[South Korea]] ([[Renault Samsung]]) }} [[Nissan Shatai]], [[Kanda, Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]

The second generation Rogue is a version of Nissan X-Trail and inspired by the Hi-Cross Concept to adapt to the US and Canada markets.<ref>{{cite news
the Greek myth: title=All-New Nissan X-Trail SUV is Also the 2014 Rogue for North America
column9: archivedate=12 August 2016}}</ref> Changes include optional third row 7 passenger seating, standard 4-wheel independent suspension, electric power-assisted steering, 4-wheel disc brakes with an anti-lock braking system. This generation has an interior size similar to Nissan's [[Nissan Murano
column12: Maxima]]. For the 2018 model year Nissan decided to drop the third row option in favor of optimizing interior passenger room and cargo utility space.

The vehicle was unveiled at the 2013 Frankfurt Motor Show.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2014 Nissan X-Trail is the Rogue's identical twin [w/video]
column8: archivedate=17 July 2017}}</ref> US models went on sale in November 2013 as a 2014 model year vehicle. Early models included 2.5 L 4-Cylinder [[Nissan QR engine#QR25DE
column18: 0}}, Xtronic CVT [(Continuously Variable Transmission) Jatco CVT8]<ref>[[List of Jatco transmissions]]{{Circular reference
column19: date=November 2017}}</ref> with standard Sport Mode switch, 3 trims (S, SV and SL, each in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive).<ref>{{cite news
column20: title=Nissan remakes popular Rogue SUV for 2014
column27: title=Nissan Rogue redesigned with three rows for 2014
column34: title=日産自動車、新型「ローグ」（2014年モデル）を世界初公開 2013年11月より販売開始
column41: title=ALL-NEW 2014 NISSAN ROGUE MAKES U.S. DEBUT – Reservations Being Taken Ahead of the Bold Compact Crossover's Fall Launch

The 2016 model comes with technology such as [[NissanConnect]] with Navigation, Siri Eyes Free and many other new features. Eight exterior colors are offered.<ref>{{Cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=5 Cool Things You Didn’t Know About the 2016 Nissan Rogue {{!}} Kingston Nissan Blog

Manufacture of the 2014 Rogue began at [[Smyrna, Tennessee]] as the facility's 10 millionth vehicle.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2014 Rogue kicks off production as 10,000,000th Nissan built in Tennessee

Production of the Rogue crossover at South Korean manufacturer Renault Samsung Motors's Busan plant started in September 2014, with an annual capacity of about 80,000 units.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title = Nissan will start building Rogue in Korea to meet U.S. demand
column12: title=Renault Samsung Motors starts Nissan Rogue shipments to U.S.
column20: archivedate=2014-09-26 }}</ref> The 2014 Rogue received the distinction of being the first automobile to be manufactured in [[South Korea]] for a Japanese automaker and sold under a Japanese brand, thanks to the [[Renault–Nissan Alliance]], in which the Rogue is built by [[Renault Samsung Motors]] in [[Busan]].<ref name=\"FT\">{{cite web
column23: title=Nissan to produce cars in South Korea

In calendar year 2016 the Rogue became Nissan's top-selling model for the 1st time, a total of 329,904 sales reflecting a 14.9 percent increase.<ref name=\":2\">{{Cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan Group reports December and 2016 calendar year U.S. sales

The Rogue is currently holding the Top Safety Pick For [[IIHS]] Ratings. With the safety features from the first generation, it also includes lane departure warning, frontal collision warning, object detection warning (SL Trim Only), and a 360 degree backup camera.
Small Overlap Front Passenger: Acceptable (2019 and newer)
The Small Overlap Test, introduced in 2012 by the [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
the Greek myth: IIHS]] simulates a frontal collision on 25% of the driver's side. Since its adoption, the IIHS has noticed several automakers making non-symmetrical modifications to their vehicles, the Rogue being one of them. Another Small Overlap Test was conducted on a number of vehicles including a 2014 Rogue, but was conducted on the passenger side instead. Based on this test, the Rogue would have received a \"Marginal\" rating if the IIHS were to provide ratings for passenger-side protection. The crash test's intrusion was 10 inches further into the vehicle on the passenger's side than on the driver's side and completely tore off the structural door hinge pillar on the passenger side.<ref>{{Cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Passengers at risk in small overlap crashes

The Rogue was redesigned for the 2014 model year. The redesigned Rogue shares no ratings with the previous design, built since the 2008 model year and given a new name for 2014-15, the Rogue Select. Starting with the 2014 year, the Rogue was awarded Top Safety Pick+ by IIHS ([[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]]).<ref>{{cite web

Nissan vehicles built 2014 to 2017 were put under a recall as the occupant classification sensor (OCS) would think that an adult in the passenger seat is a child. They recalled over 6 million vehicles for either reprogramming or replacing.
The Rogue was facelifted for the 2017 model year, with restyled headlights and taillights, and [[Light-emitting diode
the Greek myth: LED]] [[daytime running lights]] standard on all trim levels. The SL trim will also be available with full LED headlamps with HID as part of the SL Premium Package. The front grill plastics also changed, with the wider V-Motion Grille, that Nissan has throughout its lineup.

Automatic Emergency Braking, Blind Spot Warning and Rear Cross Traffic Alert became standard safety features for MY 2018 both in US and Canadian markets.  [[Lane centering#Nissan ProPILOT
the Greek myth: ProPILOT Assist]] is an option on the SL trim.<ref>{{Cite news
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Nissan ProPILOT Assist technology makes U.S. debut on 2018 Rogue – reduces the hassle of stop-and-go highway driving

the Greek myth: hybrid]] Rogue debuted January 2017, with limited availability for the 2017 model year. The hybrid features regenerative braking, pure drive hybrid emblems, energy monitor, hybrid battery status, under-floor storage area replacing Divide-N-Hide@ Cargo System, a 2.0 Liter 4 cylinder gasoline engine (power: 141 hp and torque: 141 lb-ft) and Xtronic CVT combined with an electric motor (power: 40 hp) and Lithium-Ion battery, for a combined power of 176 hp. The Lithium-Ion battery is located below the thick flooring of the under-floor cargo storage area. The Rogue Hybrid is available in two trim levels, SV and SL, but does not offer third-row seating (\"Family Package\") and Divide-N-Hide Cargo System due to the bulk of the [[Lithium-Ion battery]].<ref>{{cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=2017 Nissan Rogue / Rogue Hybrid Official Photos and Info –Â News – Car and Driver

In 2007 the Rogue was featured on the television series ''[[Heroes (U.S. TV series)
the Greek myth: Heroes]]'', and in 2014, Nissan became the exclusive automotive partner for the launch of Apple's [[iTunes Radio]], with the campaign theme \"Make the Ordinary Extraordinary.\"<ref>{{cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Apple iTunes Radio picks Nissan as first automotive launch partner

[[File:Star Wars Celebration Orlando 2017 Nissan Rogue Rogue One Star Wars Limited Edition.jpg

A special edition model known as the \"2017 Nissan Rogue: Rogue One [[Star Wars]] Limited Edition\" inspired by the 2016 film ''[[Rogue One]]'' was released for the 2017 model year.  Available with the glacier white or the magnetic black exterior color and charcoal interior, the Rogue One Edition is only available on the SV trim levels and features a panoramic moonroof, BOSE Audio System, black glossed front grille, black gloss accents on the front and rear bumper, black chrome door handles, black roof rails, black smoked twin LED projector headlights with HID, black wheels, death trooper helmet replica, and Rogue One Edition badging and emblems on the exterior and the interior door sill panels as additional standard features for the Rogue One model versus the regular Nissan Rogue. Only 5,000 units of this limited edition were built.<ref>{{cite web

From 2017, the United States sales figures of the Rogue included the smaller [[Nissan Qashqai
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Nissan Rogue US car sales figures

A version of the global [[Nissan Qashqai]] was released in the US market for the 2017 model year as the ''Nissan Rogue Sport''. The vehicle serves customers interest in a smaller, lower price-point Rogue after the discontinuation of previous-generation Rogue Select. The Rogue Sport is sightly smaller than the regular Rogue and comes with a 2.0-liter direct-injected I-4 rated 141 hp at 6,000 rpm and 147 lb-ft of torque at 4,400 rpm. Compared with the Rogue, the Rogue Sport is 12-inches shorter overall, 0.4-inch shorter and has a two-inch shorter wheelbase.<ref name=\"First look\"/> Trim levels include S, SV, and SL with FWD or AWD. The 2017 Nissan Rogue Sport is made in Kyushu, Japan.<ref name=\"First look\">{{cite web
the Greek myth: title=2017 Nissan Rogue Sport First Look

The Labours of Hercules}}: Nissan]].  It made its debut in October 2007 for the 2008 model year.<ref name=\"3rd\">{{cite web
column6: title=New Nissan Rogue Third-Best-Seller for Company
column11: archivedate=2012-12-29}}</ref> The current model, the second generation launched in 2013, is the [[United States of America]]’s and [[Canada]]’s version of the [[Nissan X-Trail]].

It is currently Nissan's best-selling vehicle in the [[United States]].<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan scores as top brand in 2017 AutoPacific Vehicle Satisfaction Awards with five Best in Class wins - Automotive World
column10: title=May U.S. auto sales: Ford outsells GM in surprise turnabout

The Rogue is powered by a {{convert
column8: QR25DE]] engine mated to a standard [[continuously variable transmission]],<ref>{{cite web
column12: accessdate=2016-02-29}}</ref> and comes standard with front-wheel-drive. The Rogue costs less than Nissan's [[Nissan Murano
column25: accessdate=2016-02-29}}</ref> offers only slightly less passenger volume than its V6-powered sibling, and a nearly equal cargo area of {{convert

The first generation Rogue remained in production for the 2013–2015 model years as the Rogue Select.{{citation needed
The Rogue is manufactured at the [[Nissan Smyrna assembly plant]] in [[Tennessee, United States]].

The Nissan Rogue made its debut at the [[North American International Auto Show]] in [[Detroit]] on January 7, 2007. It replaces the [[Nissan X-Trail]] in [[Canada]] as Nissan's entry-level [[Sport utility vehicle
the Greek myth: SUV]] and the [[body-on-frame]] [[Nissan Xterra]] in [[Mexico]] due to the Smyrna plant freeing capacity for the 2009 [[Suzuki Equator]], but the [[Nissan Xterra
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: Xterra]] continued on sale in the [[United States]] and [[Canada]] through 2015 after being withdrawn from the Mexican market after the 2008 model year.

The Rogue comes in three trims in the United States:  S,SV and SL. S is the base model, which comes factory equipped with [[anti-lock brakes]]; air conditioning; cruise control; power windows, locks, and mirrors; remote keyless entry; and AM/FM/CD stereo with four speakers and auxiliary input jack.<ref>{{cite web

An optional \"360 Value\" package on the S model adds 16-inch alloy wheels, auto-dimming rear-view mirror with rear-view monitor, body-color rear spoiler, chrome grille, and rear privacy glass. An S Krōm trim edition includes Krōm integrated body design, center-exit exhaust, body-color rear spoiler, 17-inch brilliant-finish aluminum-alloy wheels, and rear privacy glass.<ref>{{cite web
Both trims are available with [[front-wheel drive]] and [[all-wheel drive]].<ref>{{cite web

Safety features in the Rogue include front airbags, side-impact airbags, side-curtain airbags with rollover sensors, tire-pressure monitor, ABS with brake-assist and electronic brake-force distribution, traction control, and anti-skid control. The following summarizes the [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA) Crash Test Ratings<ref>{{cite web

In the IIHS evaluation of the 2013 model year, the Rogue achieved a \"Good\" [[crashworthiness]] rating for Head Restraints & Seats, Side, and Moderate Overlap Front, while achieving an “Acceptable” rating in Roof Strength, and a \"Marginal\" rating in Small Overlap Front. Modifications were made starting in the 2014 model year which increased the Small Overlap Front and Roof Strength ratings to \"Good\".<ref>{{Cite web
* 2010 Rogue Awarded ''[[Consumers Digest]]''{{'}}s Automotive Best Buy Award.
* 2010 Rogue Received the U.S. [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration]] (NHTSA)'s Highest Side-Impact Safety Rating(five stars).

Changes to the Rogue include redesigned gauges recolored from orange to black, redesigned center dash for addition of the navigation system, redesigned exterior featuring a new front fascia and grille, new front and rear spoilers, new chrome side door guard molding trim accents, new front and rear tire deflectors and a new chrome license plate finisher; new 18-inch aluminum-alloy wheels for the Rogue S Krōm Edition and Rogue SL Package, new low rolling resistance tires (available with the 17-inch aluminum-alloy wheels) and a new under-body cover.

The Rogue S Krōm Edition is a version of Rogue S with more aggressive styling, sport-tuned exhaust, 18-inch polished wheels and tires, a unique grille and bumper with fog lamps, and other styling tweaks. The vehicle was unveiled at the 23rd Annual International Z Car Convention in Nashville.
US models went on sale at Nissan dealers nationwide beginning August 13, 2010. Early models include S and SV.<ref>{{cite web
The SV is available with an optional SL package, adding leather seats, touch screen navigation system and 18\" alloy wheels, along with other premium features.
Nissan vehicles with [[Garmin]] Navi 750, 760 and 765 GPS devices, which included Rogue sold with the Garmin devices between 2008 and 2010, were recalled in 2010 due to overheating.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan joins overheating Garmin sat-nav recall
column8: archivedate=13 July 2017}}</ref> On November 23, 2011 Nissan announced a recall of 7,365 2011 Rogue vehicles for improperly manufactured electric power steering (EPS) assist units, which over time could cause the power assist feature to fail, causing a loss of power assist and an increased risk of an accident.<ref>{{cite web
column16: title=Nissan recalls 2011 Rogue over power steering concern

Changes to 2012 Rogue includes new aluminum-alloy wheels design, sport mode to the CVT, one new exterior color (Graphite Blue), Around View Monitor for SL package, which creates a composite top-view of the vehicle's surrounding and displays it through a LCD monitor.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2012 Nissan Rogue gains optional Around View Monitor [w/video]

\"Special Edition\" (replaced \"Krom\" edition) adds 16-inch alloy wheels, a premium audio system, satellite radio, privacy glass, rearview monitor, and fog lamps to the S trim.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title= 2012 Nissan Rogue gains Around View monitor
column10: title=2012 Nissan Rogue Gets a Tiny Price Bump

In Canada, the Rogue comes in S and SV trim in front- or all-wheel-drive, and in a top-line SL trim in all-wheel-drive.
In February 2012, Nissan recalled 2,983 MY 2012 versions of the Murano and Rogue, because the tire pressure monitoring system was not activated when the cars were assembled.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2012 Nissan Murano, Rogue: Recall Alert

The Select was a continuation of the first generation Rogue sold alongside an all-new Rogue that went on sale in 2013 as a 2014 model.  Since the production capacity allowed for the first generation to be built in conjunction with the 2nd generation, it allowed for a lower entry price to Rogue customers as well as fleet sales. It went on sale in January 2014 as a 2014 model year vehicle and was continued through 2015.  Nissan then announced that 2015 would be the final year.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan's current Rogue renamed Rogue Select, will live alongside next gen
column8: archivedate=7 September 2017}}</ref> The Rogue Select was not offered in Canada.

The Rogue Select was built in Nissan's [[Kyushu, Japan]] plant.<ref>

the Greek myth: image = 2014 Nissan Rogue S AWD front left.jpg

column15: [[Gangseo District, Busan]], [[South Korea]] ([[Renault Samsung]]) }} [[Nissan Shatai]], [[Kanda, Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]

The second generation Rogue is a version of Nissan X-Trail and inspired by the Hi-Cross Concept to adapt to the US and Canada markets.<ref>{{cite news
the Greek myth: title=All-New Nissan X-Trail SUV is Also the 2014 Rogue for North America
column9: archivedate=12 August 2016}}</ref> Changes include optional third row 7 passenger seating, standard 4-wheel independent suspension, electric power-assisted steering, 4-wheel disc brakes with an anti-lock braking system. This generation has an interior size similar to Nissan's [[Nissan Murano
column12: Maxima]]. For the 2018 model year Nissan decided to drop the third row option in favor of optimizing interior passenger room and cargo utility space.

The vehicle was unveiled at the 2013 Frankfurt Motor Show.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2014 Nissan X-Trail is the Rogue's identical twin [w/video]
column8: archivedate=17 July 2017}}</ref> US models went on sale in November 2013 as a 2014 model year vehicle. Early models included 2.5 L 4-Cylinder [[Nissan QR engine#QR25DE
column18: 0}}, Xtronic CVT [(Continuously Variable Transmission) Jatco CVT8]<ref>[[List of Jatco transmissions]]{{Circular reference
column19: date=November 2017}}</ref> with standard Sport Mode switch, 3 trims (S, SV and SL, each in a choice of front-wheel or all-wheel drive).<ref>{{cite news
column20: title=Nissan remakes popular Rogue SUV for 2014
column27: title=Nissan Rogue redesigned with three rows for 2014
column34: title=日産自動車、新型「ローグ」（2014年モデル）を世界初公開 2013年11月より販売開始
column41: title=ALL-NEW 2014 NISSAN ROGUE MAKES U.S. DEBUT – Reservations Being Taken Ahead of the Bold Compact Crossover's Fall Launch

The 2016 model comes with technology such as [[NissanConnect]] with Navigation, Siri Eyes Free and many other new features. Eight exterior colors are offered.<ref>{{Cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=5 Cool Things You Didn’t Know About the 2016 Nissan Rogue {{!}} Kingston Nissan Blog

Manufacture of the 2014 Rogue began at [[Smyrna, Tennessee]] as the facility's 10 millionth vehicle.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=2014 Rogue kicks off production as 10,000,000th Nissan built in Tennessee

Production of the Rogue crossover at South Korean manufacturer Renault Samsung Motors's Busan plant started in September 2014, with an annual capacity of about 80,000 units.<ref>{{cite web
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title = Nissan will start building Rogue in Korea to meet U.S. demand
column12: title=Renault Samsung Motors starts Nissan Rogue shipments to U.S.
column20: archivedate=2014-09-26 }}</ref> The 2014 Rogue received the distinction of being the first automobile to be manufactured in [[South Korea]] for a Japanese automaker and sold under a Japanese brand, thanks to the [[Renault–Nissan Alliance]], in which the Rogue is built by [[Renault Samsung Motors]] in [[Busan]].<ref name=\"FT\">{{cite web
column23: title=Nissan to produce cars in South Korea

In calendar year 2016 the Rogue became Nissan's top-selling model for the 1st time, a total of 329,904 sales reflecting a 14.9 percent increase.<ref name=\":2\">{{Cite news
the short story collection by Agatha Chr: title=Nissan Group reports December and 2016 calendar year U.S. sales

The Rogue is currently holding the Top Safety Pick For [[IIHS]] Ratings. With the safety features from the first generation, it also includes lane departure warning, frontal collision warning, object detection warning (SL Trim Only), and a 360 degree backup camera.
Small Overlap Front Passenger: Acceptable (2019 and newer)
The Small Overlap Test, introduced in 2012 by the [[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety
the Greek myth: IIHS]] simulates a frontal collision on 25% of the driver's side. Since its adoption, the IIHS has noticed several automakers making non-symmetrical modifications to their vehicles, the Rogue being one of them. Another Small Overlap Test was conducted on a number of vehicles including a 2014 Rogue, but was conducted on the passenger side instead. Based on this test, the Rogue would have received a \"Marginal\" rating if the IIHS were to provide ratings for passenger-side protection. The crash test's intrusion was 10 inches further into the vehicle on the passenger's side than on the driver's side and completely tore off the structural door hinge pillar on the passenger side.<ref>{{Cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Passengers at risk in small overlap crashes

The Rogue was redesigned for the 2014 model year. The redesigned Rogue shares no ratings with the previous design, built since the 2008 model year and given a new name for 2014-15, the Rogue Select. Starting with the 2014 year, the Rogue was awarded Top Safety Pick+ by IIHS ([[Insurance Institute for Highway Safety]]).<ref>{{cite web

Nissan vehicles built 2014 to 2017 were put under a recall as the occupant classification sensor (OCS) would think that an adult in the passenger seat is a child. They recalled over 6 million vehicles for either reprogramming or replacing.
The Rogue was facelifted for the 2017 model year, with restyled headlights and taillights, and [[Light-emitting diode
the Greek myth: LED]] [[daytime running lights]] standard on all trim levels. The SL trim will also be available with full LED headlamps with HID as part of the SL Premium Package. The front grill plastics also changed, with the wider V-Motion Grille, that Nissan has throughout its lineup.

Automatic Emergency Braking, Blind Spot Warning and Rear Cross Traffic Alert became standard safety features for MY 2018 both in US and Canadian markets.  [[Lane centering#Nissan ProPILOT
the Greek myth: ProPILOT Assist]] is an option on the SL trim.<ref>{{Cite news
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Nissan ProPILOT Assist technology makes U.S. debut on 2018 Rogue – reduces the hassle of stop-and-go highway driving

the Greek myth: hybrid]] Rogue debuted January 2017, with limited availability for the 2017 model year. The hybrid features regenerative braking, pure drive hybrid emblems, energy monitor, hybrid battery status, under-floor storage area replacing Divide-N-Hide@ Cargo System, a 2.0 Liter 4 cylinder gasoline engine (power: 141 hp and torque: 141 lb-ft) and Xtronic CVT combined with an electric motor (power: 40 hp) and Lithium-Ion battery, for a combined power of 176 hp. The Lithium-Ion battery is located below the thick flooring of the under-floor cargo storage area. The Rogue Hybrid is available in two trim levels, SV and SL, but does not offer third-row seating (\"Family Package\") and Divide-N-Hide Cargo System due to the bulk of the [[Lithium-Ion battery]].<ref>{{cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=2017 Nissan Rogue / Rogue Hybrid Official Photos and Info –Â News – Car and Driver

In 2007 the Rogue was featured on the television series ''[[Heroes (U.S. TV series)
the Greek myth: Heroes]]'', and in 2014, Nissan became the exclusive automotive partner for the launch of Apple's [[iTunes Radio]], with the campaign theme \"Make the Ordinary Extraordinary.\"<ref>{{cite web
The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Apple iTunes Radio picks Nissan as first automotive launch partner

[[File:Star Wars Celebration Orlando 2017 Nissan Rogue Rogue One Star Wars Limited Edition.jpg

A special edition model known as the \"2017 Nissan Rogue: Rogue One [[Star Wars]] Limited Edition\" inspired by the 2016 film ''[[Rogue One]]'' was released for the 2017 model year.  Available with the glacier white or the magnetic black exterior color and charcoal interior, the Rogue One Edition is only available on the SV trim levels and features a panoramic moonroof, BOSE Audio System, black glossed front grille, black gloss accents on the front and rear bumper, black chrome door handles, black roof rails, black smoked twin LED projector headlights with HID, black wheels, death trooper helmet replica, and Rogue One Edition badging and emblems on the exterior and the interior door sill panels as additional standard features for the Rogue One model versus the regular Nissan Rogue. Only 5,000 units of this limited edition were built.<ref>{{cite web

The Labours of Hercules}}: title=Nissan North America Sales Increase 9.5 Percent in 2012
